sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you’re on the edge of a <radical>cliff</radical> with a <radical>snake</radical>, you’re <kanji>unlucky</kanji>. You’re hanging off the edge of this cliff and you can’t pull yourself back up when you notice a snake approaching your fingers. The snake looks like it’s gonna bite you. How unlucky.
meaningInfo: What will you do? You can either let go and fall off the cliff, or get bit by the snake if you keep holding on. Man, you’re unlucky.
readingMnemonic: Even though you’re so <kanji>unlucky</kanji>, you decide to take your chances and let go of the cliff. Amazingly, a <reading>yak</reading> (<ja>やく</ja>) runs below you and catches you as you fall. Saved by the yak!
readingInfo: What a nice yak this is. Perhaps your luck has turned around. Perhaps you aren’t as unlucky as you thought. Your butt sure does hurt from that fall though…
